Books.title: To Kill a Mockingbird
Books.description: A powerful novel about racial injustice, narrated by a young girl, Scout Finch, in the Deep South. It tackles the themes of racial inequality and moral growth, as Scout's father, Atticus Finch, defends a black man accused of raping a white woman.
Books.author: Nelle Harper

Books.description: A dystopian novel set in a totalitarian regime where the government, led by Big Brother, constantly surveils its citizens. The story follows Winston Smith as he struggles against a society that controls every aspect of life, including thoughts and history.
Books.author: Eric Arthur
Books.genre: Dystopian political fiction social science fiction

Books.title: Pride and Prejudice
Books.description: A romantic novel about Elizabeth Bennet, whose quick judgments and misunderstandings about others, especially Mr. Darcy, shape her journey towards love and personal growth. The book explores themes of societal expectations and the importance of character.
Books.author: Jane Austen

Books.title: The Hobbit
Books.description: A fantasy adventure where Bilbo Baggins, a hobbit, reluctantly embarks on a quest to help a group of dwarves reclaim their homeland from the dragon Smaug. Along the way, Bilbo discovers bravery and encounters various mythical creatures.
Books.author: J.R.R. Tolkien

Books.title: The Great Gatsby
Books.description: Set in the Roaring Twenties, this novel tells the story of the mysterious millionaire Jay Gatsby and his obsession with Daisy Buchanan. It explores themes of wealth, love, the American Dream, and the moral decay beneath the surface of glamour and luxury.
Books.author: Scott Fitzgerald

Books.title: The Catcher in the Rye
Books.description: A novel about Holden Caulfield, a disillusioned teenager who wanders New York City after being expelled from his prep school. The story delves into his feelings of alienation, confusion about adulthood, and struggles with mental health.
Books.author: J.D. Salinger

Books.title: Brave New World
Books.description: A dystopian novel that imagines a future world where society is controlled by technology, and people are conditioned to accept their place in a rigid hierarchy. Individuality is suppressed, and human emotions are regulated by a drug called Soma.
Books.author: Aldous Huxley

Books.title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
Books.description: Dorian Gray makes a Faustian bargain to remain youthful while his portrait ages, reflecting the corruption of his soul. As Dorian indulges in a life of vice and excess, his portrait grows increasingly grotesque, symbolizing the consequences of his immoral choices.
Books.author: Oscar Wilde
Books.genre: Philosophical fiction, Gothic fiction, decadent literature

Books.title: Frankenstein
Books.description: A gothic novel about the young scientist Victor Frankenstein, who creates a grotesque creature in an unorthodox scientific experiment, and the consequences of his hubris.
Books.author: Wollstonecraft
Books.genre: Gothic novel, horror fiction, science fiction

Books.title: The Brothers Karamazov
Books.description: A  philosophical novel by Dostoevsky that examines deep themes of faith, morality, free will, and familial conflict. It revolves around the murder of Fyodor Karamazov and the complex relationships among his sons, each embodying different philosophical views on life and ethics.
Books.author: Dostoevsky
Books.genre: Philosophical novel Theological fiction Detective novel
